Preface
This is a Learning Diary for MSc Urban Spatial Science CASA0023 Remotely Sensing Cities and Environment module.
This website contains weekly learning material with structures below:

Summary
Applications
Reflection
Conclusion



About me
My name is Rahmadita Listianingrum. I am an international student from Indonesia studying at MSc Urban Spatial Science, University College London.






Note



This book is inspired by and adapted from Dr Andrew Maclahlan’s CASA0023 Book

title: 1  Week 1 - Introduction to Remote Sensing
text: 1.1 What is Remote Sensing?

title: 1  Week 1 - Introduction to Remote Sensing
text:
1.1 Summary

1.1.1 What is Remote Sensing?
Remote sensing data is digital images and digital images are made of pixels, and pixels are representations of numeric values.
Those values represent the amount of reflected electromagnetic energy (which is everywhere, and everything reflects or absorbs it differently, and measurably). The sunlight is hitting the earth and the earth reflects the light and satellites capture it.
Electromagnetic energy has waves, have wavelength



Electromagnetic Waves


Source: Google Earth Engine 101 Stanford Geospatial Centre
Spectral sampling
RGB, Red Green Blue Spectrum
reflect vs absorb
in each spectral/spectrum, the image will be white if it reflects the spactrum
255 spectrum of each RGB
Observing the surface of the earth
Satellites can see OUTSIDE RGB (more than 3 spectrum/band), such as infrared, panchromatic (black n white, take the intensity value), shortwave infrared, thermal infrared, etc.
Classifying the pixels through the wavelength

1.1 Summary

1.1.1 What is Remote Sensing?
Remote sensing data is digital images and digital images are made of pixels, and pixels are representations of numeric values.
Those values represent the amount of reflected electromagnetic energy (which is everywhere, and everything reflects or absorbs it differently, and measurably). The sunlight is hitting the earth and the earth reflects the light and satellites capture it.
Electromagnetic energy has waves, have wavelength

Source: Google Earth Engine 101 Stanford Geospatial Centre

RGB, Red Green Blue Spectrum

255 spectrum of each RGB
Observing the surface of the earth
Satellites can see OUTSIDE RGB (more than 3 spectrum/band), such as infrared, panchromatic (black n white, take the intensity value), shortwave infrared, thermal infrared, etc (Knuth, 1984).

title: Remote Sensing Learning Diary
text:
How to use this book
This website is hosted on GitHub. Data used within the practicals is available online, however occasionally websites can undergo maintenance or be inaccessible due to political factors such as government shutdowns.
To get the most out of this book spend a few minutes learning how to control it, in the top right of this webpage you will see the following tools:

 search the entire book for a specific word
 control the side / menu bars
 share this book on twitter and/or facebook
 GitHub repository for this book
 my personal twitter account
 my linkedin profile







Note



This book is inspired by and adapted from Dr Andrew Maclahlan’s CASA0023 Book
